node_2: cleverness of characters in sitcoms or movies
edge: none of the comedy comes from the characters being clever, unlike in a lot of sitcoms or movies

you can really play the intensity and gravity and seriousness of the moment, and just rely on the circumstances being funny. The joke is kind of the situation you're in, or the way you're reacting to something, as opposed to the characters just saying something witty.

node_2: real event that inspired the plot
edge: Tripp Vinson, a producer and friend of executive producer Chris Bender, went missing from his own Las Vegas bachelor party and blacked out, waking up in a strip club being threatened with a large bill he was supposed to pay.

Jon Lucas and Scott Moore sold the original script of The Hangover to Warner Bros. For over $2 million, about three friends who lose the groom at his Las Vegas bachelor party and then must retrace their steps to figure out what happened.
Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, and Bradley Cooper were all casual acquaintances before The Hangover was filmed, which helped in establishing a rapport and chemistry amongst their characters.
Jeremy Garelick and director Todd Phillips added additional elements such as Mike Tyson and his tiger, the baby, and the police cruiser to the original script sold by Jon Lucas and Scott Moore.

node_2: writers guild of america, west's screenwriting credit system
edge: Jon Lucas and Scott Moore retained writing credit in accordance with the Writers Guild of America, West's screenwriting credit system.
principal photography for The Hangover took place at Caesars Palace for fifteen days.
principal photography for The Hangover took place in Nevada for fifteen days.
principal photography for The Hangover was done on a budget of $35 million.
Alan is portrayed counting cards while playing blackjack at The Riviera in the scene from The Hangover.

node_2: wild wild west gambling hall & hotel
edge: Jade's home was depicted at the Wild Wild West Gambling Hall & Hotel in The Hangover.

node_1: the bungalows hostel (then known as hostel cat)
edge: The Bungalows Hostel (then known as Hostel Cat) featured a facade built by the production team to appear as a wedding chapel in The Hangover.
Exteriors of Atomic Liquors were filmed for The Hangover.

node_1: el cortez hotel and casino (on fremont street)
edge: Exteriors of El Cortez Hotel and Casino on Fremont Street were filmed for The Hangover.
Lindsay Lohan was in talks with Phillips for the role of Jade in the film but was ultimately not cast due to being considered too young for what was discussed.
The suite damaged in The Hangover was built on a soundstage, while the suite at Caesars Palace was also featured.

The scene where Mr. Chow jumps out of the trunk of the Mercedes-Benz 220SE and assaults the protagonists with a crowbar was filmed adjacent to the Las Vegas Strip at the intersection of East Mandalay Bay Road and Haven Street, which remains a dirt lot.
There was a piano in the real suite where the scene with Mr. Chow and the protagonists was filmed.
Helms improvised a scene with the piano on the soundstage, which became known as 'Stu's song' in the film.
Mr. Chow assaults the protagonists with a crowbar in the scene filmed adjacent to the Las Vegas Strip.
Helms had to be tutored on how to use a piano for the 'Stu's song' scene in The Hangover.
The most difficult day of shooting was the scene where Mr. Chow rams his car and attacks the main characters, which required many takes and was very painful for Helms.
The missing tooth in Mr. Chow's character is not created with prosthetics or visual effects, but is naturally occurring due to Helms never having an adult incisor grow.
In the scene where Mr. Chow assaults the protagonists, Jeong jumped on Cooper's neck naked without it being a part of the script.
